# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

To solve this task, I will create a function named `clean_column` which will:
1. Convert the input string to lowercase.
2. Strip any leading or trailing whitespace.
3. Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores.

I will then test the function with the provided example as well as a few additional cases.

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col)
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespace
    col = strip(col)
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, r"[\s-]+" => "_")
    return col
end

# Testing the function
println(clean_column("My Column"))  # expected: "my_column"
println(clean_column(" Data-Entry "))  # expected: "data_entry"
println(clean_column("user-ID "))  # expected: "user_id"
println(clean_column("Example with  multiple    spaces"))  # expected: "example_with_multiple_spaces"
```

This code snippet should correctly transform the column names according to the specs.
